it.polito.computervision.gestures

Class OneHandGesture

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polito.computervision.gestures.AbstractGesture
      • it.polito.computervision.gestures.OneHandGesture
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Gesture
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ClickGesture, PanGesture

    public abstract class OneHandGesture
extends AbstractGesture
    Implements common functionality of one-handed gestures. One hand gestures work only if there is exactly one hand touching the virtual screen.
    Author:
    giovanni

        Description copied from interface: Gesture
        Updates the state of the gesture
        Parameters:
        hands - The list of HandData of the new frame
        gestureHands - (out) The list of HandData this gesture is tracking
        Returns:
        the GestureState this gesture is in after the call

      • doUpdateState

        protected abstract GestureState doUpdateState(HandData currentlyTrackedHand,
                         boolean touchReleased)
        Concrete gestures must implement this method. The semantics are the same of Gesture.updateState(List,List). When a hand touches the screen, that becomes the currently tracked hand, and is passed to this method until either a AbstractGesture.reset() is called or the hand is lost (not tracked anymore).
        Parameters:
        currentlyTrackedHand - The HandData currently being tracked for this gesture, or null if no hand is being tracked yet
        touchReleased - true if the touch was released, false otherwise (i.e. there are more than 1 hand touching)
        Returns:
        The GestureState this gesture is in after the update.
